hints.content: Each tick mark on the number line represents one minute.

$2{:}40$ is $40$ minutes after $2{:}00$. 

![The number line goes from 0 to 60 with marks at every 10 minutes. 0 is labeled 2:00 and 60 is labeled 3:00. Marks divide the space between each number into 10 equal parts. The label 2:40 is at point 40.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/46f00c948609e1c7a79214023845b680cde78127) 

So, we move $40$ tick marks past $2{:}00$.

This number line shows $2{:}40$ graphed:

![The number line goes from 0 to 60 with marks at every 10 minutes. 0 is labeled 2:00 and 60 is labeled 3:00. Marks divide the space between each number into 10 equal parts. Point A is labeled at 40.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/755bd9785d34507e2e7ccd693c1f735abca95e40)

question.content:
**On which number line is $2{:}40$ graphed?**
